Pre-Game Insights: Canada’s Copa América run has had heroic efforts, strong showings against the world’s best, and refereeing controversies sprinkled in, drawing parallels to the 2012 Olympic team.
Jesse Marsch expects changes to the lineup, with potential opportunities for players like Ali Ahmed, Mathieu Choinière, and Tani Oluwaseyi.
18-year-old defender Luc de Fougerolles could make his first international start, providing another dependable option for the team.
Centreback pairing Moïse Bombito and Derek Cornelius has performed well, and their continued success could be beneficial for the team.
